intro: Psychotria rauwolfioides, commonly known as the "devil's breath" or "ayahuasca vine," is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant contains alkaloids, including harmine and tetrahydrobeta-carboline, which contribute to its psychoactive properties. It is often found growing as an epiphyte on trees in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical significance extends to traditional medicine and modern research into its potential therapeutic applications.
